channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid 19: More than one third of Londoners unvaccinated
item.description: Although the city has administered nine million jabs, its young population means many are unvaccinated.

item.title: Euro 2020: Men sought over Wembley final disorder
item.description: Seven men are wanted in connection with disorder at the Euro 2020 final at Wembley, police say.

item.title: Covid-19: PM and chancellor self-isolate after rapid U-turn
item.description: It comes after anger over "VIP testing" allowing them to work following Sajid Javid's positive test.

item.title: Comedian Tom O'Connor dies aged 81
item.description: The presenter and comic had had Parkinson's for many years, his family says.

item.title: 'Working in Mum's care home brought us closer'
item.description: Lydia Loader, whose mother Sally has dementia, heard her speak for the first time in 18 months.

item.title: Euros 2020: Locals repaint footballer mural daubed with racist graffiti
item.description: A community fixes a mural supporting England players within hours of it being daubed with racist graffiti.

item.title: Covid: Pioneering opera director Sir Graham Vick dies
item.description: Sir Graham, who founded Birmingham Opera Company, died of Covid "complications", it is announced.

item.title: 'Exhausted' deer rescued by lifeboat from Solent
item.description: The young animal had apparently been carried three miles out by the tide, the lifeboat crew says.

item.title: Anjem Choudary: Radical preacher's public speaking ban to be lifted
item.description: The strict licence conditions Anjem Choudary was subjected to after leaving prison are coming to an end.

item.title: McDonald's blockade: Animal Rebellion three-day protest ends
item.description: Police arrested seven people during the three-day protest and 11 more were reported for summons.

item.title: Covid: London's Metropolitan Line reopens after staff pinged by NHS app
item.description: The Metropolitan Line was closed on Saturday as control room staff were pinged by the NHS app.

item.title: Knife crime: Mum tells teenagers about her sonâ€™s murder
item.description: Jean Foster has been talking to young people about the consequences of carrying a knife.

item.title: TikTok: Dog training tips from 'small-town Essex boy'
item.description: Adam's videos on looking after dogs have attracted more than a million followers during lockdown.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How are young people responding to the jab?
item.description: The Covid vaccine is now being offered to all over 18s. So what has uptake been like for young people?

item.title: Acrobatic rat climbs washing line for food
item.description: The tightrope-walking rodent was caught on camera trying to reach some bird feeders.

item.title: 'If the boat sinks I'll still be smiling'
item.description: A man who spent five months living in a London doorway makes his new home on a renovated boat.

item.title: Fire safety rules put Newcastle couple's lives 'on hold'
item.description: The pair fear they face a potentially massive bill for the removal of combustible insulation.

item.title: Landmine-sniffing rat continues legacy of fallen hero
item.description: Ex-soldier Christopher Howes was murdered by the Khmer Rouge while working in Cambodia.

item.title: Durham A1 crash: One victim named as Paul Mullen
item.description: Three people died in the motorway collision involving two lorries and four cars near Bowburn.

item.title: Covid: Arm band calls for those with weak immune systems
item.description: Neil Collingwood's medical conditions mean he is vulnerable to Covid.

item.title: Umbrellas up at Lowestoft church to avoid bird droppings
item.description: Endangered kittiwakes nesting on the church tower are pelting parishioners with droppings.

item.title: Medieval coin brooch found in Norfolk 'was not worn by peasant'
item.description: Experts say the find confirms a medieval fashion between the 11th and 14th Centuries.

item.title: Social distancing one-way system scrapped at York's city walls
item.description: Visitors will be able to walk in both directions as wider Covid restrictions are lifted.

item.title: Covid vaccine: Tate Modern and The Oval open pop-up clinics
item.description: Pop-up vaccination clinics are opening across England this weekend including at The Open golf tournament.

item.title: Kingskerwell: Man dies after being hit by ambulance on 999 call
item.description: The pedestrian died in hospital after being hit by an ambulance "en route to an emergency", police say.

item.title: Blackpool councillor 'fat shamed' by MP over critical tweet
item.description: A Blackpool councillor claims a comment one of the town's MPs made in reply to his tweet was "nasty".

item.title: UK weather: Heat-health alert issued in England for weekend
item.description: Public Heath England wants people to look out for those who may be at risk in warmer weather.

item.title: Bereaved sister's call for breast cancer taskforce
item.description: Inspired by the Covid vaccine, a woman is calling for a similar focus on a breast cancer cure.

item.title: McDonald's blockade: Arrests as Animal Rebellion protest continues
item.description: Four people are arrested as a burger factory protest enters its third day.

item.title: Stansted Airport: Man dies after vehicle overturns on M11
item.description: Police hand out bottled water to drivers stuck on the M11 in hot weather for "several hours".

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks will no longer be compulsory in England from 19 July, but will remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Covid: What do over-18s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: The vaccine rollout is now available for younger adults. What do they need to know about getting jabbed?

item.title: How many cases in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: England v Pakistan: Adil Rashid & Matt Parkinson set up 45-run win in second T20
item.description: England's spinners squeeze Pakistan to claim an emphatic 45-run victory in the second Twenty20 and level the series at 1-1.

item.title: British Grand Prix: Lewis Hamilton overcomes time penalty to claim famous win
item.description: Lewis Hamilton fights back from 10-second penalty for a crash with rival Max Verstappen to pass Charles Leclerc and win dramatic British Grand Prix.

item.title: Marcus Rashford: Manchester United striker to 'reflect' on possible shoulder surgery, says Solskjaer
item.description: Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer says Marcus Rashford has gone away to "reflect" on whether to have surgery at the end of the month.

item.title: T20 Blast round-up: Birmingham Bears and Hampshire Hawks keep quarter-final hopes alive
item.description: Birmingham Bears and Hampshire Hawks both win to keep their hopes of reaching the T20 Blast quarter-finals alive.
